title: Shall he dance the tango of enlightenment in her private lesson waltz, or wander lost in the chaotic mazes of ignorance's carnival?
selftext:
Title :  
Ah, the curious case of India and Bangladesh – where one sees friendship and the other seems to have a bit of an identity crisis, considering itself the neighborhood consultant. If Modi wants to learn the art of staying in power, he might as well attend "Hasina's Eternal Leadership Academy." After all, she's been mastering it since 2009, while Modi's just a rookie since 2014.   


Are India's musings confined to sending roses to Russia, or do they secretly crave a new neighbour vying for the "Supreme Leader's Got Talent" competition? In the world's dictator fashion show, who will strut their authoritarian stuff next door?

Source   
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Narendra\_Modi#:\~:text=Narendra%20Damodardas%20Modi%20(Gujarati%3A%20%5B,Parliament%20(MP)%20for%20Varanasi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Narendra_Modi#:~:text=Narendra%20Damodardas%20Modi%20(Gujarati%3A%20%5B,Parliament%20(MP)%20for%20Varanasi).

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sheikh\_Hasina](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sheikh_Hasina)
